39030956.review:
[h1]Ein Muss für alle Adventure-Game-Fans!![/h1]

The Book of Unwritten Tales ist ein großartiges und fesselndes Point-and-click-Videospiel mit einer Menge Charme. Die Entwickler haben gleich an mehreren Stellen gezeigt, worauf es ankommt:

+ Zunächst wäre da die atmosphärische, ziemlich klassische Fantasy-Welt. Hier wurde nicht versucht, das Zwergen-Zauberer-Elfen-Rad neu zu erfinden oder einen besonders dramatischen Epos zu erschaffen. Stattdessen bietet das Spiel ein liebenswürdiges Setting, mit sympathischen und schrägen Charakteren und Kulissen, die genau das richtige Feeling aufkommen lassen.

+ Dann wäre da der äußerst treffsichere Humor. TBoUT versucht nicht zwanghaft witzig oder schlagfertig zu sein. Und genau in dieser Bescheidenheit steckt die Effektivität. Schwarzer Humor, zweideutige Bemerkungen und Anspielungen auf die Popkultur bringen einen zum schmunzeln oder lachen, übertreiben es aber nie, Das Spiel nimmt sich nicht zu ernst, markiert aber auch nicht den Pausenclown.

+ Das Gameplay macht eine Menge Spaß! An sich relativ simple und handelsübliche Elemente aus Adventuregames wurden mit viel Leichtigkeit umgesetzt. Die Dialoge sind toll, ziehen sich aber auch nicht unnötig in die Länge. Die Rätsel sind nicht übertrieben schwer und mit ein wenig Kombinationsgabe gerade für erfahrene Spieler recht zügig zu lösen. Trotzdem fühlt sich das Lösen jeder Quest wie ein großer Erfolg an, es macht einfach Spaß voranzukommen und eine Aufgabe zu bewältigen.

+Schließlich muss noch die gut gelungene Synchronisation erwähnt werden!

Alle diese Elemente greifen nahtlos ineinander und führen dazu, dass The Book of Unwritten Tales jedem Zocker bekannt sein sollte! Das Spiel ist fesselnd und man will es am liebsten in einem Rutsch durchspielen!

38813550.review: Genuinely surprised by this game. I very rarely get "hooked" by games, but this one did it for me. It's got great humour, a very interesting setting and I wished many of the b-stories lasted longer. The amount of diversions from the main storyline can get a bit tedious, but if you see past that you'll find a great story-driven point & click game.

38788539.review:
Beginnen wir doch einfach mal mit dem Fazit: Wer sich auch nur annähernd für Adventures interessiert und/oder mal wieder so richtig herzhaft lachen möchte bei einem Spiel, der kommt um "The Book of Unwritten Tales" einfach nicht drumherum. Klare Kaufempfehlung, ach was sag ich, KAUFBEFEHL!

Seid knapp 25 Jahren spiele ich nun mit Vorliebe Adventure-Games. Angefangen beim ersten Monkey Island, über die Lucas Games Palette, bis hin zu diversen Fangames und gar Werbegames. Um Adventures habe ich nur selten einen Bogen gemacht (sofern sie nicht Myst hießen).
Um so unerklärlicher ist es mir dass ich BouT erst jetzt so spät entdeckt habe. Aber was solls? So hatte ich dieses Jahr zur Weihnachtszeit endlich mal wieder ein richtig schönes Abenteuer auf der Kiste.

Der Einstieg war etwas schwierig da er mit dem einzigen Schwachpunkt den man dem Spiel ankreiden muss begann: Die Videosequenzen sind tatsächlich nicht das Gelbe vom Ei. Unscharf und sogar etwas ruckelig. Apropos ruckelig, auch im Spiel, wenn man sich in Gesprächen für eine Antwort entschieden hat die man seinem Gegenüber gibt, kann es hier und da zu kurzen Hängern kommen, die jedoch nicht sonderlich stören. Das war es aber schon was ich persönlich am Spiel zu bemängeln habe.
Schnell hat man sich in die Story eingefunden und begibt sich abwechselnd mit dem Gnom Wilbur, der Waldelfe Ivo, dem Abenteurer Nate und ganz kurz auch mal mit dem "Vieh"  auf die Suche nach einem mächtigen Artefakt welches, je nachdem wer es zuerst in die Finger bekommt, die Welt retten oder unterdrücken kann. 

Die Story ist okay bis gut und gewinnt vor allem durch die verschiedenen abgedrehten Kreaturen denen man begegnet. Sei es eine völlig abgedrehte Mumie, die wohl darunter zu leiden hat dass ihr bei der Mumifizierung das Hirn entfernt wurde (meine Lieblingsfigur im Spiel), ein Zauberlehrer der jedoch nichtmehr unterrichtet da er lieber Computer-Rollenspiele spielt in denen es um Strafzettel, Finanzamt und Steuererklärung geht (klar, Fantasy, Zauber und Drachen hat er ja schon im Alltag genug) oder einen zweiköpfigen Oger mit gespaltener Persönlichkeit. Die Figuren und Charakter sind allererste Sahne und werden durch die Starbesetzung in der Synchronisation noch ein weiteres Mal aufewertet. Zu hören gibt es hier unter anderem die deutschen Stimmen von Steve Buscemi/Spongebob Schwammkopf, Arnold Schwarzenegger, Adam Sandler, Whoopie Goldberg/Roseanne Arnold, Tony Shalhoub (Mr.Monk) und, und, und...

Die Spielzeit geht mit rund 15 Stunden auch okay. Manche benötigen weniger, in meinen Fall hat es sogar länger gedauert, da ich alle Gespräche in Ruhe mitgenommen habe und auch die Umgebung immer gründlich untersucht habe, ohne jedoch länger irgendwo festzuhängen.
Was uns zur Schwierigkeit des Spiels bringt. Diese wird häufig kritisiert von Spielern die meinen das Game wäre eindeutig zu leicht und ja, BouT ist tatsächlich kein Spiel an dem sich der geübte Zocker die Zähne ausbeißt. Mich persönlich hat dies jedoch nicht gestört. Zum einen ist es auch nicht so leicht dass man bequem durchmarschiert, zum anderen ermöglicht der geringere Schwierigkeitsgrad ein flüssigeres Erleben der wirklich guten Geschichte. 

Am Ende ist man tatsächlich etwas traurig dass das Spiel nun vorbei ist und man sich von den abgedrehten Figuren jetzt verabschieden muss und ich denke genau das spricht für "The Book of Unwritten Tales"

Egal ob Angebot oder Vollpreis, dieses Spiel ist jeden Cent wert.
Und ich freue mich jetzt auf die beiden Fortsetzungen, um die ich mich leider erst im neuen Jahr kümmern kann. Aber Vorfreude, schönste Freude und so.

38701952.review:
Can't imagine anyone liking the classics (the Monkey Island series, The Day of the Tentacle, etc.) recommending this game in good conscience. Most of it feels bland, and the most enjoyable character IMHO is practically a copy of the main character of Monkey Island (Guybrush). Some of the jokes are also straight taken from those games without adding any value/making the joke better (from Monkey 4:[spoiler]remember Guybrush having to do exactly as himself in another time to prevent a time paradox?[/spoiler]). The characters and story aren't interesting enough to make me care much.

If you enjoyed this, I can't imagine you not enjoying The Day of the Tentacle or the Monkey Island series. If you haven't bought this game, I'd say check them out first. Then check out other adventure games, then probably this. Cos IMHO there are lots of better point-and-click adventure games out there.

*For some reason the time I spent playing the game offline isn't taken into account and it says I've only played 12mins. Oh well...

38313504.review: The game started out well enough, the first chapter was funny and the voice-acting well done. The game unfortunately quickly lost its shine. In just a word, I would call it boring. I did finish it, but that was mostly due to OCD, because it felt like grudgingly plodding through. Biggest gripe would probably be the SLOWNESS of it all. It is funny there are zombies in this game, because let me tell you, they moved faster than the playable characters that shuffled about like (stoned) undead. I was so *bored* watching them crawl from one side of the screen to the other over and over again just to inspect another item! The gender stuff that other negative reviews also mention were awful - even if I am reiterating, it has to be said. Ivo was needlessly objectified both in terms of pure appearance as well as in terms of dialogue. Nate was a blithering Neanderthal and his sexist jokes completely ruined the game for me. If you are a girl thinking to play, think again, we don't need that stuff. If you're a guy, well you're hopefully one of the good ones and this kind of thing will be off-putting for you as well. It is the 21st century people. Out with the stone-age ooga-ooga.

38290694.review:
Grand fan de la douce époque des jeux Sierra & LucasArts, The Book of Unwritten Tales... ben c'est exactement ça.

- Une écriture drôle et référencée intelligemment (qui ne fait jamais de blagues faciles ou vues et revues à outrance)
- Un casting attachant au possible valorisé par des voix anglaises très justes
- Des puzzles toujours logiques et pourtant bien pétés dans l'esprit (Coucou Chapitre 4)
- Des outils valorisant le temps du joueur (barre espace pour voir toutes les interactions, celles-ci disparaissant quand elles ne sont plus utiles)

Les seuls moins concernant le visuel et l'animation des personnages, souffrant clairement de l'âge et d'un manque de moyens. Pour autant, les très jolis décors et l'ambiance féérique aident franchement à faire passer la pilule.

BREF, si vous aimez pointer des trucs et cliquer sur des trucs, si vous aimez rire, en voilà un jeu qu'il est bien.

37665558.review:
Obwohl der erste Teil von The Book of Unwritten Tales schon einige Jahre auf dem Buckel hat, kann mich das Point & Click Adventure nach wie vor überzeugen und macht auch nach nochmaligem Durchspielen unheimlich viel Spaß.
The Book of Unwritten Tales errinnert mich an legendäre Klassiker wie z. B. die Monkey Island-Spielereihe aus einer goldenen Ära, in der Point & Click Adventures noch das Non-Plus-Ultra waren.

Das Abenteuer rund um Wilbur, Ivo und Nate (und natürlich dem Vieh) erbt nämlich alle Stärken und Schwächen dieser Adventure-Vorbilder und braucht sich meiner Meinung nach auch nicht zu verstecken - und das will was heißen!
The Book of Unwritten Tales bringt kreative und abwechslungsreiche Rätsel (inklusive guter Lernkurve), saulustigen Dialogwitz (mit Anspielungen auf die moderne Popkultur) und zieht viele Filme und Spiele durch den Kakao.
Die größten Stärken liegen jedoch in den toll ausgearbeiteten Charakteren (inklusive den Randfiguren), den auch für heutige Verhältnisse schön gezeichneten Schauplätzen und den sehr guten, professionellen Synchronsprechern.

Auch eine Stärke ist die lange Spielzeit. Im Normalfall braucht man sicherlich so um die 20 Stunden oder eventuell etwas weniger wenn man durchrusht, da ich aber das Spiel mit meiner Tochter zusammen gespielt habe (sie liebt The Book of Unwritten Tales!), benötigten wir in etwa 27 Stunden. Dann hat man aber auch alles mitgenommen.

Ich habe tatsächlich nur 2 winzige Kritikpunkte. In Full-HD, also 1080p-Auflösung, hat man links und rechts schwarze Balken auf Grund des 4:3 Formats, für welches das Spiel seiner Zeit anscheinend konzipiert wurde. Das stört aber nach wenigen Stunden schon gar nicht mehr. Und klar, die Zwischensequenzen und die Bewegungen sind mittlerweile veraltet, dennoch ist das Spiel recht hübsch.
Ein wenig geärgert habe ich mich aber über das abrupte Ende, das hätte man besser lösen können. Denn ansonsten ist die Story klasse und spannend erzählt.

Insgesamt ist The Book of Unwritten Tales eins der besten Adventures, was ich je gespielt habe! 
Ich freue mich schon auf das Addon "Die Vieh-Chroniken" und dem 2. Teil. Meine Tochter auch ;-).

37516368.review:
After 19 hours and roughly 347,4 times looking at a walkthrough I've finished The Book of Unwritten Tales. Normally, I would learn to hate a game that is so often vague about what it wants me to do next and where you have to do very specific things in a very specific order, but this is an adventure game, so I knew what I was getting myself into. That doesn't mean that I forgive it for doing stuff that virtually every adventure game is accused of, but when you know what to expect and the rest of the game is so enjoyable, it doesn't make me rage-quit and uninstall.

Since this is also a parody of adventure games, it copies some of the worst "features" of its genre and try to pass it off as satire. Although, it probably copied many bad things just because they're "supposed to be like that".

I'm recommending this game, because all the other stuff about the game is really good. The music is very fitting and nice to listen to, the characters are funny and have great voice acting. I like the pop culture references, 4th wall breaking and anachronisms. Some of the puzzle solutions/story twists are quite clever as well. 

This is a game that becomes much better once you've played it once, but unless you want to pick some of the other dialogue choices you didn't go through the first time, I don't see much replay value. It offers German voice acting and I like that in games, since I can then practise my German. Hearing new voice actors in a different language makes the game almost as new and I won't struggle as much with the stupid puzzles as the first time.

36653465.review:
This game is great in many ways... I especially appreciate not having to worry about hack-n-slash dying all the time just to play fantasy/historical/adventure. I also appreciate the 2D point-and-click animation since 3D gives me a headache. 

But I cannot recommend this game due to one very large problem... I have attempted to get past the potion in chapter 2, 34 separate times (for the last hour). I have accomplished everything else. I does not matter how fast or slow I spin, big circles or little, one continuous stir or separate, the moment it turns white or not... the potion blows up every time and this game does not have a skip, help, or hint function. There are not any cheats online and neither of the two walkthroughs I found help. Therefore I have only been able to play 2 out of 5 chapters, less than 50% of the game before being forced to stop. I saw an earlier player had the same problem and I remember thinking, how bad could it be... frustrating beyond belief.

36475131.review:
Good
Excellent artwork that pulls you into the world
Fully 3D rendered characters means animations are snappy and integrated perfectly
Excellent characters who develop and change with the game (primarily Wilbur)
High quality voice acting on par with Monkey Island remasters (possibly better)

Bad
So many references to older games make this feel like a vehicle for fan appreciation at times
--Puzzles reference older games directly (but don't spoil solutions)
--Story settings reference LucasArts so much that I expected Stan the Salesman to make an appearance
The Plot did not have great pacing and the ending of the game feels rushed and unsatisfying
Some may find this story a bit childish

I have to recommend this to my friends who are fans of Adventure games.  The voice acting was very impressive to me.  I mean how often do you get a character with a Welsh accent as a featured lead?  And if you wondered what the actor who voices "The Witcher" sounded like when not gravel-voicing his way through that series -- check this out.  He does an amazing job voicing the Han Solo-esque Captain Nate.

I think this game really pulled me in playing as Wilbur (the afore-mentioned Welsh character).   I don't want to spoil anything, but Wilbur must accomplish several tasks to progress the story.  Playing through this progression felt similar to reading a book where you get to take the time to identify with a character and experience him/her changing.  That will probably sound like a slow-paced experience for a video game, but I liked it.  If you are still reading this then you will probably love BouT.  There is also a spinoff game and a sequel which has been released for consoles.

Note that I played this when I was on an Adventure game "kick" and my experience is colored by comparing it to recent playthroughs of games like Kings Quest (2015), Chains of Satinav, Remastered Monkey Islands, and others.

36056790.review:
Charming, often witty, and light-hearted fun. I am not normally into point and click games, though I've played through some of the classics, but I definitely enjoyed The Book of Unwritten Tales (TBoUT). At its core, the story is a hodge-podge of different tropes: There's a mcguffin, the heroes must get it and stop the big bad evil guy from conquering the world, and the power of friendship will see the heroes through. Fairly ordinary stuff, but TBoUT oozes charm. It lampoons and parodies many popular franchises and it does so really, really well. The writing captures the subject matter in an amusing way and it does so consistently.

I was also impressed by the protagonists and NPCs encountered in the game. From silver-tongued rodents to not-so-haughty elf princesses, the varied cast of characters in the game sparkles with personality. Even Captain Nate Bonnet, a third in the protagonist trio (discounting Critter, who gets his own game) and someone who I didn't really find all that interesting to begin with, really comes into the swing of things later on. He even gets his own game (co-starring Critter)!

The puzzles, while not overly hard, can be a bit of a pain. I went into the game without a guide, and it took me a bit to finish it. I suspect veterans of the genre will have no problem, but newcomers may find some puzzles a little frustrating. All in all, if you're looking for a point-and-click game that kids can enjoy for the general silliness and brain twisters, and adults can appreciate the finer points of tongue-in-cheek humor, I think TBoUT is a worthwhile investment.

36017597.review:
Ein überdurchschnittlich gutes Point & Click, eines der wenigen, die mit den Klassikern von Lucas Arts und Sierra mithalten können, 

Sehr hübsche Grafik, tolle Musik und kompetente Sprecher, viele bekannte Stimmen aus Film und Fernsehen dabei.

Die Rätsel immer fair und mit ein wenig Comedy-Logik lösbar, durch die Hot Spot Funktion auf der Leertaste alles gut auffindbar und ohne Plotstopper. Wer das nötige Sitzfleisch hat, könnte das Spiel in einem Rutsch durchspielen, ohne sich "in eine Ecke zu spielen" und festzustecken.

Es gibt ein paar Stellen an denen es zu etwas Hin- und Herlauferei kommt, zu dem in diesem Genre so manches Spiel eine Neigung hat. Aber es hält sich in erträglichen Grenzen. 

Die Charaktere sind witzig und die zahllosen Anspielungen auf bekannte Filme und Computerspiele fand ich durchweg gelungen und amüsant.

Ein kleines Manko, über das sich meiner Meinung nach aber leicht hinwegsehen läßt: Das Spiel wurde in der Zeit entwickelt, als die Monitore sich gerade vom 4:3 Format lösten. Es wurde auf 16:10 angepasst und hat keine Unterstützung für 16:9 oder andere Wide-Formate. Dadurch hat man unter 16:9 immer zwei schmale schwarze Balken rechts und links am Bildrand.

36001093.review: Having been tossed on the trashheap of afterlife, (Retired), and not having much to laugh about at this time of life, this was FANTASTIC! First thing I have done in 2 years that had me laughing all day long and leaving me chuckling everytime I think of some of the interaction between the characters. THIS is what games should be, something to have fun with, something you want to play again some other day when you think of SOME section of the game that sticks with you because it was just plain good writing on the part of the programmers, story writers, and artists who made it come together. The one and only complaint I have is the same one I have always had with this type of game. Why, in the name of all that is sacred, do programmers put ARCADE sequences in a game like THIS. The "dance" puzzle was nothing but a test to see how fast a person can slam the keys on the keyboard, nothing else, and was nothing but an irritant in an otherwise GREAT game. Have not fired up TBUT2 yet, but looking forward to it.

35917635.review:
THE BOOK OF UNWRITTEN TALES czyli fantasy na wesoło.
Czasami bywa, że to, z jakiego środowiska ktoś pochodzi niejako definiuje całe jego przyszłe życie. Ale nie każdemu to odpowiada. W point and clicku The Book of Unwritten Tales poznajemy elficką księżniczkę Ivo którą bardziej ciągnie do przygód, niż do siedzenia na tronie oraz gnoma Wilbura, który po prostu nie podziela ani pasji, ani talentu reszty swojej rodziny do technologii. Losy ich obojga splatają się za sprawą pewnego archeologa i znalezionego przez niego potężnego artefaktu. Ich życie nabiera wtedy niebywałego rozpędu ku przygodom. Wkrótce dołącza do nich nawet najprawdziwszy łowca przygód imieniem Nate, którego najpierw trzeba sobie uratować. W grze będziemy prowadzic rozgrywkę na przemian z perspektywy Ivo, Wilbura i Nate'a.
Naprawdę trudno jest recenzować ta grę nie zdradzając zbyt wiele z fabuły, która dużo czerpie, ale i  z przymrużeniem oka odnosi się do klasycznych RPG. Mamy maga, który z pasją oddaje się, no właśnie graniu w rpg na maszynie obsługiwanej od zaplecza przez serwera, który de facto jest małpą. Nasz Wilbur pochodzi z krain Białej Grani, która to nazwa na pewno brzmi znajomo dla fanów Skyrim. Nate przed stoczeniem walki w obozie orków musi najpierw podnieść level ubierając się od stóp do głów w specjalną zbroję wojownika (mimo iż „walka” to bardziej zawody niż walka 1 na 1).
Gra zachwyca już od samego ekranu menu obiecującego wstęp do fantastycznej baśniowej przygody. Cechuje ją przepiękna, kolorowa grafika i świetny humor, który chyba nie tylko mi przywołuje na myśl cykl Świata Dysku Terrego Pratchetta. Sama fabuła też jest poprowadzona ciekawie i czasami zaskakująco. Choć uderzająca bajkowość i dość prosta rozgrywka mogłyby sugerować, że jest to gra dla młodszego gracza, to zapewniam, że będzie to świetna rozrywka dla osób w każdym wieku.

Il gioco è una classica avventura punta e clicca, dove i nostri protagonisti saranno coinvolti a risolvere un intrigo che può capovolgere le sorti della guerra in corso. La storia non è male, anche se forse pecca un po' di originalità: parecchi spunti sembrano presi da altre avventure o da film ed in alcuni casi i richiami sono anche divertenti, ma in generale si sente la mancanza di qualcosa di nuovo nella storia.

La grafica non è male per essere un'avventura punta e clicca, ma mi sarei aspettato qualche filmato in più, almeno tra la fine di un capitolo e l'inizio del successivo. A volte lo stacco sembra un po' troppo netto.

Come longevità direi che il gioco dura abbastanza, io l'ho completato in 9 ore. Nessuno degli enigmi sembra di difficoltà elevata, anzi si risolvono tutti piuttosto semplicemente, e forse gli appassionati di avventure grafiche si sarebbero aspettati qualcosa che mettesse alla prova la fantasia del giocatore per risolvere l'enigma.

Voto 6,5/10

35477507.review:
The Book of Unwritten Tales was my first experience in the point & click genre, and I found it very engaging, and entertaining. I don't think I have laughed as much during a game as I did playing this. Some puzzles are straightfoward, yet entertaining, while some are much harder, even to the point of frustration. The game follows the typical LotR/Warhammer type of lore, but makes it much more bright and friendly. Yes, there are still evil villians that will smite you (with his teenage backtalk and awkward magic) and mighty dragons...although this one looks more like it belongs in Gumby (look it up!), but for every dark (technically) part of the game, there is light-witted humor to counter it, and it's great! 

If you're a fan of the point & click genre, or if you have never played one before, and you are interested in trying one out, this is the game to get!

This game offers the opportunity to play multiple characters [almost] simultaneously, and overall there are four characters to play.  This offers a varied experience and the need to play each character properly to finish chapters (or portions thereof).

35122953.review:
If you love fantasy, you might like this game. If you hate fantasy, then you still might like this game.

The Book of Unwritten Tales is a point-and-click adventure very heavily inspired by fantasy works like The Lord of the Rings and Dungeons and Dragons, with a very tongue-in-cheek, self-referential sense of humor about itself. Nearly every single fantasy trope under the sun is referenced, discussed, or blatantly mocked. But rather than undermine one's enjoyment of the story or its beautifully rendered setting, this sense of humor actually helps propel the story forward.

There are a few technical hiccups which may detract from the player's immersion, but the interface is intuitive, easy to use, and the game itself doesn't require moon logic to solve any puzzles. If you enjoy traditional adventure games, epic tales of fantasy, or gut-busting comedy, then I recommend giving this one a go.

34942745.review:
A fantastic PnC adventure for adventurers! I love the humor in the game. The references and jokes weave their way through (and sometimes are) the story, much like a Pratchett book. The characters other than the gnome have virtually no backstory, which I actually didn't miss.

The puzzles are overall very straightforward and quick, with a fairly good range of puzzle types. Walking everywhere is done well (double click on doors/roads to skip walking across a room, and a quick-travel map system is employed in a few sections) and the developers did put in holding spacebar to show clickable objects.

It was interesting to me to solve puzzles by swapping the playable characters and using their individual characteristics. The gnome is short, the human is strong, etc. Having to employ two or three characters to solve certain puzzles adds a level of complexity that I really enjoyed.

It's a pretty short game (I clocked in at just over 12 hours for a full playthrough, some of which was idling) which is on par with most other PnC adventures I've played.

Very much recommend this game for anyone who likes the genre, Pratchett-esque references and has a sense of humor.

34219057.review:
„The Book of unwritten Tales“ ist ganz sicher eines der besten Point-and-Click-Adventures, die ich bisher auf der Platte hatte. Beim Spielen habe ich mir durchaus Zeit gelassen und mir alle Dialoge in Ruhe angehört, so dass der Abspann erst nach etwa 15 sehr unterhaltsamen Stunden über den Monitor zog.
Besonders gefallen hat mir der Schwierigkeitsgrad. Muss ich in anderen Spielen oftmals in die Komplettlösung schauen, so haben sich mir die in der Regel logischen Rätsel in „The Book of unwritten Tales“ doch meist sehr schnell erschlossen und ich konnte die Lösung immer selbstständig erarbeiten. Unterfordert habe ich mich dabei nicht gefühlt, bin aber angenehm zügig vorangekommen – insgesamt ein sehr zufriedenstellendes Gefühl.
Die Wahl der Haupt- und Nebencharaktere fand ich gelungen und abwechslungsreich. Die meisten Figuren waren mir sehr sympathisch, was bei solchen Spielen sehr wichtig ist. Besonders die deutsche Vertonung ist klasse – so viele bekannte Stimmen aus Film und Fernsehen vereint in einem Spiel habe ich bisher noch nicht erlebt.
Außerdem hervorheben möchte ich die vielen Anspielungen auf andere PC-Spiele, Filme und Bücher, von denen es in der Spielwelt und den Dialogen nur so wimmelt – ich musste immer wieder herzhaft lachen! Das Spiel trifft genau meinen Humor. Die Story macht Spaß, endet jedoch meiner Meinung nach etwas abrupt.
Grafisch macht das Spiel im Jahr 2017 immer noch eine gute Figur. Die unterschiedlichen Schauplätze sind recht abwechslungsreich und jeweils liebevoll und detailiert dargestellt. Insgesamt genau mein Stil, gleichwohl es in Sachen Grafik sicher bessere Adventure-Spiele geben mag.
Freunde von Adventure-Spielen, können hier bedenkenlos zugreifen. Aufgrund der guten Zugänglichkeit und des ausgewogenen Schwierigkeitsgrades würde ich dieses Spiel aber auch jedem Einsteiger empfehlen.

Very nice graphic adventure in the vein of the LucasArts classics. While it isn't very difficult and puzzles might seem a little straightforward if you're used to brain-twisters, the game more than makes up for it with funny dialogues, interesting story (not terribly original but it does have a couple of twists, one of which I REALLY did not foresee) and tons of references to videogames and pop culture phenomenons from Discworld to Star Wars. In conclusion, I'd suggest it to any player who likes classic adventure games, or who just enjoys some good-hearted smirk, and I'm looking forward to playing the sequel that I'm installing already.

33276676.review:
Up front, I baught this game as part of the entire bundle with a 40% discount.
I just finished part 1 and will defenately continue to the two other parts.

[h1] BRIEF: [/h1]
This is a good and fun game to play. It has some wierd moments and the ending is "kinda" open (Obviously, it has a sequel). I would recommmend buying the bundle even without the discount for anyone who likes good old fashioned adventure games with great atmosphere, music, and mostly - breaking of the 4th wall.


[h1] THE GOOD: [/h1]

A good old fashioned game where you play as 4 different characters throughout. The gaming is solid and the reasoning behind the use of items, combination of items and puzzles is solid. It has an option (SPACEBAR) to see POI in the screen you are in for those (like me) who hate pixel hunting in such games.
The game's length felt just right. It wasn't dragging on but it wasn't short. The characters are fun to play, the humor is light and includes breaking of the 4th wall (Where the game refers to itself as a computer game). Furthermore, the interaction with characters in the game is fun, well voiced acted (in a toonish way) and filled with jokes about modern days society (minor spoiler: [spoiler] example, having a go at WoW players [/spoiler]).


[h1] THE BAD: [/h1]

At some points of the game, the cutscenes are a bit off. The story just jumps ahead a bit with you needing to fill in the gaps of what just happened. Sometimes the sound effects are not synced with what occurs on the screen and it seems odd. Switching between playable characters is sometimes very annoying as it forces a few seconds of transition animation (sometimes you can skip it, sometimes you can't).
The graphics are OK, but i do believe they came to serve a cartoonish style of Grim tales. Even though, clipping and operation of objects could have been done much better (like passing a object to someone in the game simply shows your character doing an empty hand gesture).


[h1] SUMMARY: [/h1]
I wouldn't consider the bad in this game all that important. Overall, it really goes over you head as soon as you simply enjoy this light humor game which offers a few hours of relaxed giggles and smiles.

YOU SHOULD BUY!

33138613.review: Worthy of being called a classic lucasarts adventure, pays homage with parodies and references to that period but stands out on it's own with new IP and great storyboard.

Puzzles: entry level, meaning it is easy. In comparison to the Deponia series, there are less steps of mucking about with your items to reach solution imo.

Graphics: when resolution is maxed the graphic is crisp. There are little glitches throughout the game but since this is point+click, it shouldn't bother you.

Bugs: I encountered only 1 bug in which I couldn't select anything or open menu so I had to restart the game but luckily I saved not so long before. If I haven't, I would have been very annoyed.

Parody: this game is full of little parodies and homage to movies, literature and games. Such are Harry Potter, Lord of the Rings, Terry Pratchett, World of Warcraft, etc.

Characters: as this is a 3rd person point and click game, you get to play number of different characters. Different characters such as a gnome, elf, human and a strange pink creature called Critter becomes a protagonist that can be played. Sometimes you get to switch between 2-3 characters at once to solve puzzles that involve teamwork or interaction.

NPCs: Great amount of time will be spent on interacting with other characters and they are all very funny. Compared to The Book of Unwritten Tales 2, the interaction needed between you and NPCs are somewhat shallow and too easy.

Length: It took me 13 hours to finish and approx. 2-3 hours of that has been just leaving it running while I was doing something else. I wanted it to last a little longer.



I have played The Book of Unwritten Tales 2 before the first game and believe me, the second one is waaaaay better in length and puzzle complexity but in order to play the second one, I highly recommend that you play this one first. 
You'll see that almost all the NPCs reappear in the 2nd game and you'll get to know more about them better as a character. 
My recommendation is to put this on the wishlist until it goes on sale and spend that extra money on The Book of Unwritten Tales 2.
This game is a good break from other intense and violent games.

24 hours of completed wow game-play! 5 out of 5 for this absolute gem of a game/interactive story! 
3rd person point and click multi character role playing game! 
It’s a visual delight, soundtrack is perfect character‘s voices couldn‘t be more suited. Characters are defiantly character’s with the funniest not rated G lines I‘ve ever experienced in a game! 
From Wilbur to Death in bunny slippers (and the well placed game comments) and beyond the funny lines never quit! 
I laughed out loud (with headphones on) so ya might wanna be home alone. 8-/ 
This is the most visually pleasing funniest game I’ve played to date! 
The Three Main Interactive characters are: 
1. Ivo aka  Ivodora Eleonora Clarissa-
a Princess from Silver Forest 
2. Wilbur Weathervane- a Gnome from a bar/pub in White Ridge Mountain
3. Nate- a Human freelance treasure hunter (humans have no imagination) ,) 
4+½ (limited time with) critter. A.. well, critter.
Personally and it’ll be personal choice; I preferred playing as Wilbur! 
All three come together never knowing each other from different worlds to achieve a goal!
They work together to get a sacred artifact to it’s destination for a Gremlin archeologist. Yes, I just said all that..
In some scenes you take control of more than one and need to go back and forth to complete a task! 
Wilbur and Nate are wisecracking all the way!
I was surprised at first when the Dev’s had Wilbur look right at me if I didn’t move on fast enough.. However, they all do throughout game-play! Clever! 
Just let Wilbur stand still awhile and see his hmm,, trying not to get this one edited.. Scratching.. Will that not be replaced with hearts????  
And be sure to keep clicking on “the chair” in Wilbur’s home before he heads off on his adventure. 
I’m in awe of this King Art developed game! I would have loved to spend a day in the minds that created this one.. Or forever! 
Quote:
“ There are 60 locations to explore with a total of 40 non-player characters and about 250  Interactable items” 
End Quote: 
Yeah, there’s that all that too!  
If anyone thinks this is a childish or beginners game… Bahahahaha!! 
Huge thumbs up to King Art and all who worked on this nearly a decade old amazingly stunning purely brilliant fantasy adventure tale!

Die Rätsel sind sehr logisch und für mein Geschmack für ein Anfänger in dem Genre trotzdem zu einfach aber so hat man ein schönen Spielfluss und muss nicht alles 5 mal Probieren und verzweifeln.

This is a very vanilla adventure game which panders annoyingly to fans of the genre with various references to old classic titles. There's nothing original here in game design nor art style, but it still delivers a satisfying gaming experience and by no means disgraces itself in any way (other than the tacky references which is symptomatic of a newer wave of P&C adventures which refuse to break free of the shackles of the golden age -- so actually, it disgraces itself on a fundamental level... so I take EVERYTHING back).

If you're looking for a gentler game of the genre to get stuck into which ticks all the boxes then this is a solid choice, but it's hardly a gem of an adventure.

Excellent. Il y a bien longtemps qu'un jeu video ne m'avait pas autant fait rigoler. Un univers fantastique vaste et bien fait à découvrir, des héros sympatiques et décalés, une ambiance bon enfant, des clins d'oeil et de l'autodérision, une histoire à rebondissement, des aventures à foison... tout ce que j'aime dans ce style de jeu.

Dans sa catégorie, il est quand même plutôt facile et c'est vraiment la mise en scène de l'aventure qui m'a emballé plus que sa résolution. Les énigmes paraissent très très simples au début mais heureusement se densifient lorsque l'on progresse, avec en particulier quelques sections à faire en interaction sur plusieurs personnages.

Quelques imperfections cependant, surtout au niveau du doublage, quelques textes en allemand au milieu de la VF, quelques phrases qui écorchent les yeux et les oreilles et des videos d'intro et de fin non sous-titrées. A noter aussi la présence d'un mini-jeux de coordination (une séquence de touches à suivre au clavier) bien pénible au milieu dun jeu d'aventures plus à base d'exploration, de logique et d'assemblages, heureusement qu'il tolère pas mal d'erreurs sinon je n'aurais pas fini le jeu autrement qu'en tripattouillant les fichiers.

31323093.review: The Book of Unwritten Tales ist wahrlich ein gelungenes, sehr schönes Point-and-Click-Adventure. Die Grafik hat mir sehr gut gefallen. Nur die letzte Videosequenz, quasi der Abspann des Spiels, hatte bei mir sehr geflimmert. Weiß nicht ob das absichtlich so gemacht wurde oder ob es irgendein anderes Problem ist. Die deutschen Synchronsprecher haben allesamt perfekte Arbeit geleistet. Die Story des Spiels war größtenteils gut durchdacht. Zum Ende hin hatte ich jedoch den Eindruck das den Entwicklern nicht mehr viel eingefallen ist. Man läuft dann eigentlich nur noch durch dieselben paar Screens. Auch die Sache mit der Zeitreise empfand ich eher so wie schnell noch reingeklatscht als wirklich durchdacht. Ansonsten gibt es zahlreiche witzige Anspielungen, die durchweg für gute Unterhaltung sorgen. Die Rätsel lassen sich alle ohne große Mühe lösen solange man alle Gegenstände findet, was aber, auch ohne sich die anklickbaren Bereiche anzeigen zu lassen, kein Problem dargestellt hatte. Es gibt ein paar, ich nenne es jetzt mal, "Minigames" die etwas Abwechselung in den Spielverlauf bringen. Die Sache mit dem Tanzen war jedoch eine sehr knifflige Angelegenheit. Dort habe ich mir mit einem AutoHotkey Skript beholfen. Alles in allem ein sehr schönes, witziges Spiel das mir viel Spaß gemacht hat.

30689823.review:
„The Book of Unwritten Tales“ ist ein Point’N’Click Adventure, der etwas eigenen Art. Ist das Spiel aber einzigartig?
Das Spiel beginnt und meine erste Reaktion: „Haha. Wie alt ist das Spie? WAS? Das Spiel ist von 2012?“ Die Grafik des Spiel ist nämlich nicht gerade die schönst. Sie ist anschaulich und erfüllt ihren Zweck, aber sie ist nicht gerade das Gelbe von Ei. Texturen, Hintergründe und Charaktermodel wirken veraltet. Ein weiteres kleines Manko, beim Spiel via Steam werde ich jedes Mal aufs Neue aufgefordert, das Spiel zu installieren. Das führt zu einer nervigen Meldung von Windows (10), aber an sich ändert sich in der Datei nichts.

Die Geschichte von „The Book of Unwritten Tales“ ist an sich genommen nicht so gut. Wir bekommen einen Ring und müssen ein Buch finden und die muss man wiederum dem Magier der Stadt der Menschen geben um den Krieg für die Fraktion der Menschen zu entscheiden. Das Spiel erzählt diese Geschichte aber auf eine sehr charmante Art und Weise und ist voller Humor. So nimmt sich das Spiel selber auch nicht ernst und erzählt von einem MMO (wir befinden uns im Mittelalter!) in dem wir Akten drucken, ordnen, sortieren und Papiere für das Amt ausfüllen. Eine irrwitzige Idee, das es eine Mittelalterwelt gibt in der die Menschen dort das machen, was wir hassen und die Papiere raiden als gäbe es keinen Morgen. Das Spiel durchbricht mehrfach die vierte Wand die Charaktere in die Kamera schauen und buchstäblich mit mir, dem Spieler, zureden versuchen. Bei solchen Momenten, die zudem ihr witzig sind, wächst einem Wilbur Wetterquarz, einer der Protagonisten doch ans Herz.

So schön und cool die Charaktere, Dialoge und „Aufträge“ auch sind, die Spielmechanik ist dafür nicht annähernd so toll. An einem Point’N’Click Adventure kann man an sich nicht viel falsch machen. Die Rätsel im Spiel sind auch alle logisch, humorvoll und nehmen ein Klischee nach dem anderen aufs Korn. Jedoch artet das in einfaches „Welches Item muss ich mit welchen komponieren“-Klickereien aus. Ich habe mich ziemlich oft dabei erwischt, wie ich die Items in meiner Leiste alle durchklicke um auf eine eventuelle Lösung zu kommen. Des Weiteren kann man bei einer solchen Spielart Dialoge nicht skippen. Ich musste mehrmals ein und denselben Dialog hören nur weil ich den NPC das falsche Item geben wollte

Zusammenfassend (alias TL;DR): Ich empfehle das Spiel all denjenigen, die über die technischen (Installationbestätigung bei jedem Start) und spielelementaren (veraltete Spielmechaniken und Grafiken) hinweg sehen können. Man soll nicht in der Erwartung reingehen eine meisterhafte Geschichte zu erleben, sondern entspanntes Gameplay, lustige Dialoge und humorvolle „Questreihen“ zu bekommen. Dann werde ihr spaßige ~15 Spielstunden mit dem Spiel haben.

30656940.review:
This game was brillliant and had me captivated right from the very beginning.

The art style and graphics coupled with the brilliant medi-evil style soundtrack really help the games atmosphere and setting to shine.

The characters are fleshed out well and the voice acting is brilliant accross the board even to the NPC's.

The gameplay and puzzles are really easy but this game is more about enjoying the story as it unfolds rather trying to provide any real challenge. 

The story is the games best asset and has some very clever moments in the plot, especially towards the games final moments where some very clever story telling had left a huge impression on me.

If you enjoy point and click adventures this game is a must and highly recommended, just dont expect any difficult puzzles, which in this games case, isnt a bad thing at all - thanks to its charm.

Brilliant Story Telling - 8/10

30371098.review:
I never heard of this game and it was just sitting in my library and at the back of my backlog garthing dust. A random friend recommended it to me and between the 3 games that he picked from my library this one seemed least interesting...

I am sure glade I was 100% wrong!!

This game is an awesome RPG/Puzzle/Advanture game using multiple characters.
A band of advanturers got dragged into a world changing event and chains of events were set in motion! A monster, A gnome, an Elf and a human have to work together to save their magical world.

Good 3D rendered animation + great background artwork. The graphics are very well done a very smoothly placed and drawn. Artist did an fantastic job!!

The music are few but intriging. Not the best but fits the back ground well.

Story conversations are very interesting with a lot easter eggs about other games such as WOW. (3 pieces of copper but no arcanite crystal!!) 

The Plot is also very well written and interconnected to each other. It does gets a bit confusing at the end and I can feel a bit of rushing the game at the end so it's not perfect.

Overall it's a very fun 10-12 hours of game play that you will enjoy!!

Really no blood and violents at all so it's not game for everyone.

8.7/10 and recommended for every single casual gamers.

30338469.review: A well-designed PAC game. I enjoyed some of the innovation involved in switching characters (and just the change in perspective). I wasn't sure how I'd feel about the fact that you can only combine items if they'll work (no real need for experimentation), but I didn't mind it. I found it streamlined the game, but it took out some of the fun of trial and error (and seeing what the designers came up with in terms of character response). There is a similar feature where you can't just repeatedly click on items to observe them - usually after 2 observations, the item then becomes inactive if it's not intended to be used later. Again, the feature was kind of nice, but took away some of the challenge and fun of thinking outside the box. I tend to like at least a few trickier puzzles in a game that get me stuck for a while, but this game was relatively straightforward. It was fun, but not particularly challenging.

29937258.review:
When I bought a game, I didn't know much about it and didn't have high (any) expectations. The main reason why I bought it was that it is an adventure which as the genre I enjoy playing. The quick scope on reviews both personal and professional (ie gaming magazines) was indicating highly quality game. 
After finishing it, shortest description of it would be like trying a most trendy, hip cocktail in town which everybody is drinking and telling you that it's amazing, but you just have a sour taste in your mouth after tasting it. 
Now, the game is not bad, it's just.... in the middle. 
The game is dancing on the line between comedy/parody of fantasy RPG genre with the story of heroes who are saving a world. Comedy/parody part really didn't work for me. Jokes are way too cliche and outdated to be interesting or fun. Majority of jokes are directed to mocking WoW which I see as plain laziness of authors. Few jokes would fit better (maybe) but when the majority of it is in that direction, it just doesn't cut it. Most fun part for me was the sarcastic personality of Captain Nate which is present in his conversations. Ivo has her moments too in that light. Since parody goes deeply into the game, it's hard to take story anyhow seriously which by itself looks unfinished or full of holes (if it's intended to be done in the way how it was). Shortest summary of the story would be: heroes are on the mission to hide already hidden artifact even from themselves. Yes, I know how it sounds and that's how it feels when you finish the game. In the end, it doesn't feel like there is any big or inspiring story, just a bunch of lined side quests. 
Puzzles are pretty simplistic and not presenting any significant challenge.   
In the end, the game is not bad and for players who didn't play much or at all adventure games, it is a very decent introduction to a genre. For veterans, it is an easy, relaxing piece. 
I don't regret buying and playing it but I don't think that I would miss much if I didn't.

29881876.review:

Oh, and those evil fellows in the caves who bring you back to the start repeatedly. For walking slowly through that whole place is maddening, especially when one apparently has overlooked the existence of an entire small cavern tucked away just out of sight. Looking everywhere is key.

After looking through the illustrations in the credits as well, I feel as though I would have loved the gameplay much more if it had left in that form. It looks much better than the 3D format.

29837529.review:
[h1]Hintergrundgeschichte:[/h1]
Das Point&Click-Spiel "The Book of Unwritten Tales" erzählt die Geschichte, wie die Elfe Ivo, der eigentlich unverlässliche und Geld gierige Nate sowie der neugierige abenteuerluste Gnom Wilbur in ein Abenteuer voller Magie und Konfrontationen stolpern. Die Erzhexe ist auf der Jagd nach einem allmächtigen Artefakt, welches ihre Boshaftigkeiten ins Unermessliche steigern könnte. Das gilt es nun für die drei Protagonisten zu verhindern.

Die Handlung ist sehr abwechslungsreich und man darf viele verschiedene Kulissen und Charaktere entdecken. Positiv finde ich, dass nach/zwischen bestimmten Handlungen kleinere Filmausschnitte gezeigt werden. Dadurch wird alles etwas aufgelockert. Die verschiedenen Charaktersequenzen wechseln sich ab oder überschneiden sich, wodurch sich viele neue Sprachabschnitte eröffnen, sich jedoch weder Überforderung noch Langeweile bilden.

[h1]Steuerung:[/h1]
Linke und rechte Maustaste um sich zu bewegten oder interagieren. Leertaste für Hinweise um einen herum. Also übliche und leicht verständliche Steuerung. Das Interface mit Gegenständen befindet sich im unteren mittleren Bildschirmbereich.

[h1]Gestaltung in Bild und Ton:[/h1]
Von Charakteren über Kulissen bis Filmsequenzen: Es wurde sich richtig Mühe gegeben. Zwar sehen die Charakteranimationen manchmal steif aus, aber das Spiel ist ja auch schon etwas älter und das ist daher zu verkraften. Ganz ehrlich: es gibt eine Menge Kulissen und jede ist individuell gestaltet. Das Interface im Hauptmenü ist in Form eines alten Märchenbuches dargestellt. Musik, Hintergrundgeräusche und Synchronisation sind gut gewählt. Alles in allem nichts zu meckern.

[h1]Schwierigkeitsgrad:[/h1]
Der Schwierigkeitsgrad der Rätsel ist insgesamt durchwachsen. Manche Lösungen sowie Interaktionen sind logisch und simplerer Natur, manche benötigen längere Lösungswege und andere noch eine zusätzliche Portion Kreativität. Eine gute Mischung, die sich sowohl für Anfänger im Genre, als auch für die Veteranen des Point&Click eignen sollte.

[h1]Achievements:[/h1]
(Leider) Keine.

[h1]Technisches:[/h1]
Technische Probleme traten bei mir nicht auf und das Spiel lief flüssig. Es gibt den Autosave und auch die Möglichkeit, individuell zu speichern. Ebenso hat man verschiedene Sprachen zur Auswahl.

[h1]Mein Fazit:[/h1]
Mir hat "The Book of Unwritten Tales" sehr gut gefallen. Die verschiedenen Charakterstränge und Interaktionsmöglichkeiten hielten mich stets bei Laune und vermittelten mir den Eindruck, eine gute Geschichte nachzuerleben. Der Titel ergab für mich mit ein bisschen Hirnschmalz ebenfalls Sinn. Ich hatte keine technischen Probleme und war von den gezeichneten Kulissen begeistert. Ganz davon abgesehen trafen die sarkastischen Kommentare und der teils trockene Humor gegenüber anderen Spielen genau meinen Geschmack. Für mich war das Spiel jeden Cent wert und ich empfehle es daher weiter.

______

4 Feb 2017: First Review (About 17 hours in @ this time, approximately), My personal experience and review: 

I really, really, really enjoy this type of game..  It serves many purposes for me.  Right now, I'm going through a huge amount of circumstances out of my control (and some within) so I need some serious distraction, and in my case, for a female in her mature years, let's just put it that way. I'm no 20 something any longer but I do still enjoy youthful games, but only if they have some serious brain work.. Sometimes these puzzles seem mundane or what-have-you but they do serve a higher purpose than obvious.  Logic is an important one. Process of elimination. This game gives you that. And exploration. Humor (I love the humor).

 Different character's perspectives. I enjoy that also. This game keeps my mind going so it's not thinking of my woes, mourning, losing a loved one .... another one....  again.  And the workload I have ahead of me.. The physical care I must tend to. These things can overwhelm me to the point I can't focus on movies, games or anything I'd normally enjoy. Though I must sit up to play this game (it's not on my ipad, lol), I really appreciate the game a lot for helping  me to enter another world, not my own, yet I'm very much a part of it.

You can feel that in the game. You get pulled into the story (if you read them) and you can skip (nice when you've already read it a time or two). I like that option there!  Who wants to keep hearing the same things over and over with no ability to bypass it?! This game has that freedom of choice.

Some voices aren't the greatest.  Some actions can become tedious as you try to figure it out. Brain foood is what I call that type of game play.

The humor :lol: I Love it so far. I think you can see my hours played somewhere around here. This game is satisfying.
P&C, HOGs, Adventure, Humor (not in all games but, it is in this one :D) = a very nice relaxing evening.. I turn on my soft lighting, get comfortable and see what they have in store for me next. :)

Not everyone enjoys what I like so this is my experience. Performance is good too. (OHHH!! And don't let me forget.. The maps are usable to teleport, as well as being able to click a "door" and click again to skip walking. HAHA! Love that! Saving me that precious time! So, if you like what you've read, I think you'll like the game.  

Best Wishes..
xts

29585130.review:
Wilbur è un piccolo nano alla ricerca di avventura per diventare un eroe e un grande mago, Ivo una principessa elfica che ama camminare ed esplorare i boschi ed infine il capitano Nate un cacciatore di tesori. Questo è il gruppo di eroi che loro malgrado si ritroveranno a lottare per il bene contro la malvagia arci-strega Mortroga e suo figlio Munkus per difendere il mondo dalla loro sete di potere ed evitare che vengano in possesso dell'artefatto del divino fato in grado di donare infiniti poteri a chi lo usa.
Il gioco si sviluppa in cinque capitoli in cui prenderemo il controllo di un personaggio (più avanti nell'avventura potremo scegliere chi usare tra quelli a disposizione) che ci porterà a dover risolvere svariati compiti per poter proseguire nella storia, non ci sono veri e propri enigmi in quanto il tutto si risolve parlando con i vari npc e cercando e combinando tra loro i vari oggetti che troveremo sparsi nei luoghi che visiteremo.
Il gioco scorre molto bene, buone le musiche di sottofondo, buona la grafica (peccato per le bande nere ai lati) un po' meno i filmati non proprio all'altezza. Buona a mio avviso la caratterizzazione dei personaggi e molto divertenti gli scambi di battute tra di loro e i riferimenti qua e là ad altri giochi e ai film. Davvero una buona avventura punta e clicca senza pretese che si lascia giocare senza difficoltà che si può concludere in una ventina di ore circa.
In rete trovate un'ottima traduzione in italiano.

29407393.review:
근래에 포인트앤클릭 어드벤처하면 데포니아를 비롯한 데달릭의 게임들이 생각나지만 편하게 즐기기엔 다소 어려운 난이도로 몰입을 어렵게 만드는 게임이 대부분이였다. 
 그에 비해 북 오브 언리튼은 장르적 특성을 잘 살리면서도 유저 편의를 위한 다양한 장치를 둠으로써 난이도를 적절히 조절하는데 성공한 것으로 보인다. 예를 들어 더 이상 사용되지않는 장소나 아이템에 대해 아이콘을 지워 불필요한 반복 작업과 유저의 혼란을 줄여 스토리에 좀 더 몰입할 수 있게 해준다. 
 물론 이러한 모든 요소는 완성도있는 한글화가 없었다면 다 부질없는 내용이다. 사실 데달릭의 게임들을 비롯한 기존의 포인트앤클릭 장르의 게임들이 어렵게 느껴지는건 한글화가 되지 못한 영향도 무시하지 못하기 때문이다. 
 간만에 짧은 시간이나마 푹 빠져 플레이할 수 있었던 게임을 만나 기쁘다. 클래식이라 할만함. 강추!

*추천 포인트

- 포인트앤클릭 어드벤쳐의 초심자도 스트레스 없이 진행할 수 있는 난이도 설계
- 개성있는 캐릭터와 유머와 위트 넘치는 짜임새 있는 스토리로 몰입도 높음
- 불필요한 반복작업 배제로 적절한 플레이 타임 확보
- 호불호가 크게 갈리지 않을 만한 그림체
- 높은 수준의 한글화

28638117.review:
Ich habe Unwritten Tales 1,2 und die Critter Cronicles als Bundle im Sale gekauft. Um den Preis, um den ich die Spiele erhalten habe, sind sie wirklich in Ordnung und ich empfehle sie weiter (solange man nicht den Vollpreis zahlt). Ich habe mich damals entschieden Unwritten Tales zu kaufen, da ich Point&Click, Rätsel und Fantasy liebe :) Diese drei Genres sind auch tatsächlich im Spiel enthalten.
Die Grafik ist recht lieb gemacht, die Rätsel schwanken zwischen watscheneinfach und mühsam, sind aber alles in allem lösbar. Was ich persönlich furchtbar finde, sind die ganzen Anspielungen auf andere Bücher, Filme, Spiele, Fandoms. Manche sind tatsächlich witzig, aber großteils wirken sie angestrengt. Teilweise werden sogar Passagen oder Dialoge aus Büchern/Filmen wörtlich bzw. fast wörtlich zitiert. Mir gefällt das nicht, denn so kann das Spiel keinen eigenen Humor und keinen eigenen Charme entwickeln, wodurch ich keine Bindung zu den Charakteren aufbauen konnte. Andere mögen die wörtlichen Zitate lustig finden, ich finde sie eher mühsam.
Ich habe bis jetzt nich viel Zeit in Unwritten Tales gesteckt, da es mein Interesse nicht wirklich wecken konnte. Ich werde wohl trotzdem immer wieder eine halbe Stunde investieren, um das Spiel irgendwann durchgespielt zu haben.

Fazit:
+ liebe Grafik
+ es macht Spaß, die Anspielungen auf andere Fandoms/Bücher/Spiele/etc. zu suchen
+ angenehme Musik
+ einfache Steuerung
- Anspielungen werden mit der Zeit zu viel/zu offensichtlich
- Figuren haben durch die Anspielungen keine eigene Persönlichkeit

Im Sale trotzdem eine Kaufempfehlung!

28497395.review:
Ivo is a whiney bitch, Wilbur is a clueless idiot, Nate is a boring asshole, and Critter is a blod that doesn't speak a lick of english. 
Aside from the annoying characters, the voice acting is terrible, with pauses between lines about 2 seconds each and line delivery with very confusing inflections.

The humor is very specific, basically if you think references by themselves are funny you will find this game funny. Other than that, the game has standard meta-references to the fact that you're playing a point&click.

The puzzles are extremely easy, especially in the last few hours of the game. The second half of chapter 4 is someone giving you everything you need to solve a puzzle, and then chapter five is you trading items around as the game tells you to. 90% of the puzzles are character X wants item y so you can obtain item z. 

The story is boring, though to the game's credit it starts out just fine. I was excited to get to play as these characters and see them get fleshed out, but nothing of the sort happens, except for the rogue character having a forced selfless moment. The story's ending however, is one of the least satisfying endings to a game I've ever played. I won't go into detail, but prepare to be disappointed big time if you decide to play this game even after reading this review.

Not recommended, there are plenty more good point&click games out there for point&click fans.

28295755.review:
Wonderful point-and-click game with lovable characters and interesting puzzles and one of my favorite games in the genre from the last five years. 

I often feel that games that try to be funny often end up being cringeworthy instead, but the characters in this game are actually amusing. Even when they fall short of funny, they still achieve lovable and whimsical rather than awkward. The voice actors must take quite a bit of the credit for this as they are brilliant. The puzzles should be solveable as long as you make sure you click on everything and try all combinations, and the game does not contain any puzzles of the type that requires lots of calculations or trying to guess what the developers thought a certain symbol looked like etc. 

Although I generally really, really like this game, its weak points might be the traditional storyline (an ordinary person must save the world), as well as the villain being a bit too cartoonish for my taste. However, this might be a positive aspect for a younger player as this means the villain is not scary. The difficulty level of the puzzles might also be an issue for those who want more challenging games - although the puzzles are not super easy, they are not extremely difficult either. This game is also more on the light-hearted side, so if you are looking for something darker and more serious, this might not be the game for you. 

That being said, I strongly recommend this game for someone looking for a casual, delightful and charming point-and-click game with entertaining and logical puzzles that do not stop the flow of the game.

27789458.review: Tato adventura patří mezi mé nejoblíbenější. Jedná se o hru s poměrně dobrým příběhem (klasika, parta kladných hrdinů musí zastavit zlé záporáky a zachránit svět), opravdu nádherným grafickým zpracováním a designem různých levelů a určitě nesmíme opomenout silnou stránku hry - humor. Ano právě ty skvělé srandovní dialogy a narážky na ruzné filmy, hry a otřepané příběhy mě bavili až do konce. Hra je vskutku jednoduchá a skvělá na relaxaci. Pomocí stisknutí tlačítka umožňuje zviditelnit objekty se kterými jde manipulovat, takže pokud už vás nebaví jezdit kurzorem po cele obrazovce a čekat dokud na něco nenarazíte, tak toto jistě uvítáte (mě to trvalo 1 kapitolu než jsem zjistil, že tam tato funkce je). Velkou výhodou této hry je dlouhý příběh, tudíž delší herní doba, také různorodost postav a následné ovládání, kdy máte na lokaci třeba i 2-3 postavy, mezi kterými můžete jednoduše přepínat a které mají jiné hlášky na předměty. Závěrem The Book of Unwritten Tales rozhodně doporučuji, i následné pokračovaní, které nebavilo o nic méně.

27736173.review:
The Book of Unwritten Tales ist ein wirklich witziges und ansprechendes Point & Click-Adventure.

Es ist dabei nicht nur für die üblichen Point & Click-Spieler interessant, denn es greift mit seiner Geschichte die üblichen Stereotypen aus diversen (MMO)RPGs auf und überzieht sie dermaßen, dass man einfach nur noch darüber lachen kann.
Auch nach mehrfachem Spielen im Laufe der Zeit haben diese Gags für mich nichts von ihrem Witz verloren und sind noch immer aktuell.

Auch die Mechanik und Grafik empfinde ich als ansprechend.

Aus diesem Grund kann ich dieses Spiel einfach nur jedem Point & Click-Liebhaber empfehlen.

26760887.review:
Ich bin absolut begeistert. 
Die Story ist unglaublich durchdacht und die Rätsel gestalten sich das ein ums andere Mal interessant und kniffliger als das davor.
Die Grafik ist sehr schön gestaltet und bietet die Möglichkeit mit den Hauptcharaktären in eine Welt aus Spaß, Abendteuer und Tollkühnheit abzutauschen.
Sowohl Teil 1 als auch Teil 2 wurden in knapp 2 Tagen durchgespielt, was nicht daran liegt, dass die Aufgaben zu einfach gestaltet waren, sondern vielmehr, dass wenn man einmal anfängt das Buch zu öffnen, man es nicht weglegt bis es durchgelesen ist. Das Ende von Teil 2 ist so konzipiert worden, dass es absolut unerträglich scheint auf den nächsten Teil zu warten, ohne vor Spannung zu sterben.
Ich liebe dieses Spiel mit all seinen Facetten, größtes Lob geht an dieser Stelle wohl an die absolut fantastischen Texte-Schreiber, Witz, Sarkasmus und unzählige Anspielungen auf Filme, Spiele oder auch den Alltag lassen "The Book of Unwritten Tales" zu einem unvergesslichen Spiel werden.

Danke!

26493518.review:
Ha csak a történetet nézném, akkor azt mondanám ez egy nagyon jó játék. Nekem nagyon tetszett hogy a játék egyáltalán nem veszi komolyan magát; szinte minden 3 mondat tartalmaz valamilyen vicces utalást.
A problémák a játékmenetnél kezdődnek, ami legtöbb helyen szükségtelenül nehéz és bonyolult. Nem beszélve arról, hogy egy idő után rettenetesen unalmassá válik, hogy egy dolgot többször is meg kell vizsgálni, mert aktiváltam egy script-et ami egy új interakciót nyitott meg egy olyan tárgyon/személyen amivel/akivel már egyszer interakcióba léptem. Legtöbbször azért akadtam el a játékban, mert tudtam hogy mire lenne szükségem, de azt valami teljesen logikátlan helyről lehetett megszerezni.
A környezet grafikája elég szép, csak a karaktereknek van kissé baltával faragott kinézete.
Összességében egy oké játék. Egy esélyt megérdemel, már csak azért is mert nagyon jól kiparodizálja a fantasy és rpg műfajt.

26241884.review:
그저그런 평이한 어드벤쳐.

the book of unwritten tales(이하 테일즈)를 예전에 한 번 실행시켜보고 영 처음부분이 끌리지 않아서 지운 기억이 있다. 그리고 최근에서야 다시 실행시켜서 엔딩을 보게 됐다. 그 당시 게임을 지웠던 이유는 뭔가 움직임이 부자연스러웠고 영 시작부분이 흡입력이 떨어져서 그런 것이었는데 그 느낌은 게임 끝날 때까지 없어지지 않았다.

시작부터 게임을 깎아내리는 것같아 미안하지만 사실 이 건 그냥 수없이 쏟아져 나오는 어드벤쳐 중 하나일 뿐 어떤 특색도 없는 게임이다. 우선 이야기 플롯이 너무 엉성하다. 우연히 노움과 엘프가 세상을 구하기 위해 여행을 떠난다는 건 우리가 너무나도 많이 듣던 이야기중 하나일 뿐 아무런 특색도 없는 것이 사실이다. 게임 자체가 패러디가 많으니 스토리도 어느 정도 용납해줄 수 있다고 할지 모르겠지만 패러디가 많은 것과 게임의 스토리가 식상한 것은 별개의 문제이다.

더군다나 모델링이 전부 엉성한 3D라 모션들이 굉장히 어색하다. 조금 심하게 말하면 예전 3D어드벤쳐들이 나왔을 때의 그 어색한 모델링에서 전혀 나아진 것이 없다. 사양이 높지 않아서 저사양 컴퓨터에서도 돌아간다는 것이 그나마 유일한 장점이다. 

게임 내에 유머도 겯들이고 패러디 요소도 많지만 사실 그렇게 재미있는 부분도 없고 오로지 눈이 가는 건 그나마 주인공 중 하나인 엘프의 갸날픈 몸매뿐이다. 퍼즐 난이도는 너무 쉬운 편이고 막히는 부분도 스페이스 누르고 그냥 이것 저것 클릭하다보면 다 풀린다. 특히 아이템끼리 상호작용하는 경우에만 밑에 자막이 뜨기때문에 퍼즐 푸는 난이도가 상당히 낮아졌다.

안 좋은 점을 잔뜩 늘어놓기는 했지만 어쩌면 내가 이미 너무 많은 어드벤쳐를 해왔고 최고의 작품들만 생각하다보니 아쉬워서 이렇게 쓴 것 같다. 사실 평이한 어드벤쳐 만드는 것도 그렇게 쉬운 일만은 아닌 것이고 어쩌면 어드벤쳐를 많이 해보지 않은 사람들에게는 상당히 재미있는 게임이 될 수 있을 것이다. 자신이 루카스아츠의 각종 고전 어드벤쳐를 다 해본 사람들이라면 플레이를 말리는 편이고 어드벤쳐라고는 숨은그림찾기류의 모바일 게임이나 종종 하는게 전부라면 재미있게 할 수 있을 것이라고 생각하니 본인이 잘 판단해서 하기를..

평점 : 2.5/5

26196800.review:
[h1]The Book of Unwritten Tales[/h1]

Pointer & clicker qui vous plonge dans un univers de fantasy ou vous côtoierez, ogre, orc, elfes, gnomes, lutins et plus si affinité. Vous incarnerez tantôt Wilbur un gnome, tantôt une elfe Ivo ou encore un humain, Nate et même une créature un peu plus difficile à définir et à comprendre Critter. Ce jeu est bourré d’humour et de clins d’œil qui vous feront surfer du seigneur des anneaux à starwars en passant par indiana jones, etc. Comptez entre 15 et 20h pour finir l’aventure qui vous tiendra facilement en haleine jusqu’au bout. Les graphismes et animations ainsi que la musiques sont également de grande qualité. Seul défaut que je trouve à ce jeu, sa difficulté, le jeu est facile et les amateurs de challenge resteront largement sur leur faim ici. 


[h1]En conclusion :[/h1]
Si on exclu son absence de difficulté, « The Book of Unwritten Tales » apporte tous les ingrédients pour être classé dans les incontournables du genre. Une aventure qui vous fera voyager et rire et que je recommande vivement !


[b]Bilan : 9/10[/b]

26157702.review:
I'm a Fan of Point and Click games since the early nineties when the mouse was introduced to PC (Yes, I lived Keyboard-Only days) ..

Being from that generation, Success factors for a Good P&C are :

- Logical Puzzles .. in some games humor spoils the logic
- Few screens to mingle with : Some games expand too much .. this is not RPG ..
- Balanced Atmosphere and steady story
- Mouse-only controls. I don't like P&C that tries to be console friendly and introduces controller.

I can say that this game delivers it all .. one of the best P&C games I played in a long time. 

I rate it 9/10

26132315.review:
I'll recommend The Book of Unwritten Tales for those that are in the mood for a comedy point and click adventure game. Really, if you are in the mood for something a bit more serious this certainly isn't for you. The amount of reference humor and fourth wall breaking is turned up to the top on this one. At some parts even to the point where it was getting a bit too much for me. But overall the game's charm and cartoony style won me over.

The puzzles and tasks were challenging, without turning too hard. It is often needed to go and talk to characters you have already talked to in order to progress, but since this is consistent throughout the entire game, it doesn't feel as out of place, as it could have if it had only been done on a single puzzle.

You play as four characters through different parts of the game, and some parts you must switch between multiple characters to use the different strength.

All four with different personality, experience in life, and view on the world. The story is very simple, but as one of the supporting cast puts it “The battle between good and evil is never cliché!”

I bought this game  after reading some reviews which were mostly positive and I am so glad that I did.

I was a bit worried initally because it was point and click and wether it would be too old fashioned but no way is it! The puzzles are sometimes perplexing but you always get there in the end.
The humour  is also a winner for me  very tongue in cheek and if you have played other famous games you will recognise all the jokes .

25907668.review:
[b]Review zu The Book of Unwritten Tales[/b]

******************************************************************************************

Ein Point & Click Adventure der alten Schule!
Den Zwischensequenzen sieht man natürlich das gewisse Alter des Spiels an,aber der Stil der liebevollen Hintergründe und  und vor allem die humorvollen Dialoge (mit der ein oder anderen Anspielung an WoW oder einigen Filmen),lassen darüber schnell hinwegsehen.

Ich würde behaupten,dass ich relativ gut durch die Rätsel gekommen bin,diese aber nicht zu leicht sind und würde die Spielzeit mit ca. 9-11 Stunden (je nachdem wie sehr man mal an einem Rätsel hängt) als ordentlich bezeichnen.

Ich kann das Spiel für Freunde des klassichen Point & Click absolut empfehlen.

25880686.review:
A great, humorous point'n'click fantasy adventure that lets you play from the perspective of several different characters throughout the story. The intro is a little slow, but things soon ramp up as you solve the initial set of puzzles and the humour starts to shine through. If you've played any type of RPG or adventure game in the past, there are some great sequences poking fun at the genres, players and developers, lovely stuff. The humour doesn't always hit, there are some off screen sequences that don't quite come off, but its good to see a game try something a bit different. 

The artwork and style is lovely, although there are occasional glitches and not all animations fully reflect the actions that are taking place. But these are minor fiobles that don't detract from the main experience. The voice acting is generally top notch too, great to hear a Welsh accent from one of the main actors.

The game is quite easy however. Items are easy to come by, sometimes just given to you when talking to other characters and experienced adventure game players will find themselves solving puzzles before knowing why they need to. This can lead to a bit of awkwardness, but that will be the player messing with the natural flow the developers had in mind.

That said, at 17 hours playtime, the difficulty level is not too far off the mark and the Book of Unwritten Tales does not out stay its welcome at any point. A thumbs up from me and roll on the next adventure in the series..

非常棒的奇幻风解谜游戏，画面可爱，色彩明艳。剧情和台词充满了各种梗和吐槽，从序章第一个画面就感觉出对魔戒系列至死方休的致敬，而这对于戒迷来说简直太！棒！了！很多梗只有戒迷才能get到，比如精灵女主发现的各语言卷轴，其中有Quenya语和Sindarin语，然后妹子说看不懂，哈哈哈哈所以中土世界已经是被考古学家挖出来的了吗（然后妹子就把这堆纸拿去烧了……）

另外还吐槽了MMORPG，WOB的名字不由让人想到暴雪爸爸的某款游戏躺枪了。服务器是猴子在操控，说崩就崩，然后投诉信根本没人会看（毕竟猴子也看不懂）。还有HP梗也持续被玩，编剧请收下我的膝盖。

操作方面，有些谜题有难度，按空格可以显示出本地图所有可以探索和互动的地方，一定要善用，否则会卡关卡到没朋友。这游戏对喜欢奇幻题材，并且对奇幻文学有比较深了解的人更有吸引力，就是看台词和吐槽都能上瘾，不喜欢看剧情的乐趣会少很多。

25777079.review:
This was a great adventure game. Sadly, the developers abandoned it. There are many graphics and audio incompatibilities across all platforms. These problems have grown over time with newer versions of operating systems and graphics/audio/input drivers. Many users on the forums encountered show stopping bugs/crashes several chapters into the game.

I spoke to representatives from KING Art, who said the build system for this game was destroyed, and that there are many third party libraries which the game depends on. The game needs significant development to reintegrate with the latest versions of these dependencies in order to recreate a working build system. They said this is simply not going to happen, and that the bugs will not be fixed.

As there is no way to tell if the game will be completable for you, I can't recommend you buy it.

25606303.review:
Mi sono divertito molto a giocare The Book of Unwritten Tales e lo consiglio a chiunque cerchi una buona avventura punta-e-clicca, e si sente a proprio agio con l'inglese, in quanto il titolo è sprovvisto (almeno su Steam, non ho indagato oltre) di una localizzazione italiana.

I suoi punti di forza sono: la scrittura, soprattutto la carettirazzazione dei personaggi e il doppiaggio. Il cast dei protagonisti è assortito splendidamente, inoltre ogni personaggio secondario è all'altezza del suo ruolo e si integra nell'arco narrativo in modo omogeneo in ogni sua apparizione.

Ho apprezzato lo stile grafico cartoon/comic, in grado di esaltare ulteriormente con la sua spensieratezza lo humor che pervade tutta l'avventura. Ritendo che il comparto grafico sia invecchiato piuttosto bene grazie allo stile poco serioso e realistico.

Gli enigmi sono strutturati bene: personalmente ho trovato le soluzioni appaganti da raggiungere. 
Segnalo comunque che avendo già giocato a diverse avventure grafiche di questo tipo sono un giocatore abituato alle dinamiche del genere, ma potrei consigliare il titolo anche come un buon punto di inizio per avvicinarsi al genere.

La longevità è adeguata, anche se avrei giocato volentieri un capitolo in più.

Altro punto a favore del gioco sono i rimandi e le citazioni ad acuni capisaldi del genere fantasy e alle avventure grafiche della Lucas Arts, cosa che i fan di lunga data potranno senz'altro apprezzare.

25496636.review:
I must confess it was rather surprising to go back to a proper point and click adventure after a streak of somewhat half-baked ones light on puzzles and perfectly content to hand hold you throughout the entire experience in favor of delivering their narrative. Make no mistake, The Book of Unwritten Tales makes couple of modern concessions but it is, at heart, a traditional genre representative. 

Starting off, I have to say this is one helluva charming game even if it does have a few things stacked against itself, as I'll explain later down the road in this write-up. Visuals succeed almost entirely in blending various 3D and 2D assets, with few exceptions here-and-there marring the presentation primarily because age creeps into everything eventually, as well as appropriate use of soft colors and lighting goes a long way in selling you on the locales you visit. Pleasant artwork certainly helps, as well. Standout element I REALLY have to give props to is the soundtrack – it's brilliant. Fantasy fare and nothing you haven't heard before, but packs a punch and I'd bet no expense was spared in putting it together. Polygonal characters are most of the time lovingly animated with, well, character and it comes through especially when they emote.

Speaking of characters you'll be contending with more than just Wilbur the Gnome, who is portrayed as the game's central figure on most of promotional material, but as far as I'm concerned he is this game's genuine protagonist forsooth. Somewhat of a black sheep in his family comprised of a biologist, roboticist and engineers in general he instead aspires to become a mage one day. Sudden turn of events thrusts a great destiny on his shoulders and sets him down on a long road to potentially save the day and maybe, just maybe achieve his lifelong dream. Second character is a she-elf named Ivo who ends up enrolled in this adventure thanks to random chance rivaling that of Wilbur himself. There is a third person involved, but I'd rather not spoil who that is. Well, there's also a fourth. Sort of. Kinda. It's a whimsical game, what do you want?

Now that I've gushed about the positives let's get down to gritty negatives... of which there aren't that many, surprisingly. I'd only list two real negatives, because if you're into point and click adventures you already knows you're signing up for with few nonsensical puzzles and such, even though The Book of Unwritten Tales dispenses with those for [mostly] perfectly logical puzzles, and they are as follows; entire playable cast does not get equal amount of character development and that game ends rather abruptly, following what is possibly the most arduous and tedious section of the game. Which you have to retread twice. I don't know if they simply ran out of time or money, but the ending itself felt rather automated and resolved much too quickly for all the buildup that lead to it. One point that's going to be divisive for most is game's heavy use of references, both playing them straight or ridiculing while portraying how genre savvy developers are. It doesn't get into obnoxious territory and ranges from your classical Discworld to Star Wars and World of Warcraft mentions, but there was one section that served as commentary of MMORPGs and TCGs as a whole which made me bolt a smile on my face for five minutes straight. 

So, closing words. Should you get it? If you want a modern game from a genre past it's prime, but one that's long overdue for proper revival I would say yes. It's not a masterpiece but for me game's charm carried it from beginning to end.

25439791.review:
The book of Unwritten Tales is very funny classic point and click adventure.
This means that you'll often be tearing your hair out trying to solve puzzles that seem illogical until you realise what some of the stuff in your inventory does and what to use it on.
Just like the good old days then.

But where it absolutely shines is in the humor:
The dialogues you have with the other characters is really funny,especially if you have likeb fantasy novels, movies and games as there are plenty of nods, winks and satire to be found featuring most of the well known fantasy worlds and their tropes.

It's world  has a kind of Diskworld vibe to it, meaning that nothing is as you would expect it to be in the average fantasy kingdom and that the story isn't simply just about "Go you hero, get the legendary jewelled sword to slay the evil one" but that it is more about the protagonists and the sticky but strange situations they find themselves in often without any real fault of their own.

If you like old school adventures (with all their faults) you'll like this one, and the best bit is that the sequels are just as funny as this one.
